#Text=4. Neighborhood
#Text=Search Algorithm
#Text=The problem dealt with in this paper is NP-hard .
#Text=It has high structural complexity , multiple constraints and large search space , etc.
#Text=So a neighborhood search algorithm is developed based on a simulated annealing algorithm .

#Text=A simulated annealing algorithm is a random optimization algorithm based on a Monte Carlo iterative solution strategy , and has strong robustness , global convergence and wide adaptability , which is suitable for solving the problem .
#Text=In order to obtain a variety of perturbation solutions in the iteration process , four neighborhood transform operators are designed .
#Text=The functions of these operators are as follows :
#Text=adding a line randomly , deleting a line randomly , adding a section in a line randomly and deleting a section in a line randomly , as shown in
#Text=Figure 10
#Text=,
#Text=Figure 11
#Text=,
#Text=Figure 12
#Text=and
#Text=Figure 13
#Text=.
#Text=Different neighborhood transform operators are executed according to a certain probability .
#Text=Different types of perturbations are randomly applied to the current solution to obtain new solution .
#Text=Each operator can be executed independently or simultaneously , for example , one line can be added while another line can be deleted at the same time .
#Text=Let , and be the objective function values of the current solution , the new solution ( perturbation solution ) and the optimal solution in the existing iteration process , respectively .
#Text=If , is accepted as the new current solution .
#Text=Otherwise , is accepted according to the Metropolis criterion .
#Text=Metropolis criterion is that the algorithm allows the inferior solution to be accepted with a certain probability , so that the algorithm can jump out of the trap of the local optimum .
#Text=The acceptance probability in the criterion is calculated by Equation ( 46 ) .
#Text=As the temperature decreases , the probability of accepting an inferior solution decreases gradually .
#Text=( 46 ) where is the current temperature .
#Text=The algorithm is designed with the memory function of the optimal solution in the existing iteration process , that is , to remember the ‘ best so far ’ state .
#Text=As the iteration proceeds , the solution in the memory base is continuously updated until the algorithm converges .
#Text=Therefore , the objective value will approach the global optimum gradually in the iterative process .

#Text=A solution has many kinds of changes after perturbation , so even if the current solution is perturbed into the solution that has appeared in previous iterations , it will change in other directions when perturbed again , which will not have a negative impact on the results .
#Text=The overall flow of the algorithm is shown in
#Text=Figure 14
#Text=.
